headline: Oil Prices Spike After U.S. Kills a Top Iranian
abstract: Analysts warned that the airstrike on an Iranian commander raised the prospect of volatility in Iran and Iraq, two major oil producers.
lead_paragraph: Oil prices jumped on Friday, and stocks fell, on news that a powerful Iranian military leader had been killed in a strike authorized by the United States, ratcheting up geopolitical tensions in a region that supplies around 25 percent of the worldâ€™s oil and threatening to disrupt global supply.
keywords: United States Defense and Military Forces
